Name: Cablegram
Ingredients: 60 ml Straight rye whiskey (100 proof /50% alc./vol.)
Top up with Thomas Henry Soda Water
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Collins glass .
Review: Whiskey and ginger with a fresh zing of lime.
History: The Cablegram first appears in William "Cocktail" Boothby's 1908 The World's Drinks and How to Mix Them , where it's described as being "A Bourbon Whiskey and Ginger Ale Highball with a little sour added..." This forgotten classic was given a new lease of life in 2009 by Eric Alperin at The Varnish in Los Angeles, USA with a combination of ginger syrup and soda replacing ginger ale and a rye whiskey base adding a touch more kick.
Nutrition: One serving of Cablegram contains 190 calories
